title: Lady Vols ban Whitehorn indefinitely after arrest
content: The Tennessee Lady Volunteers have suspended fourth-year guard Ruby Whitehorn indefinitely following her recent arrest on felony charges of domestic assault and aggravated burglary.

title: Sanders to play Sat., downplays Gabriel remark
content: Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders is expected to play in Saturday's preseason finale at home against the Rams.

title: Source: Eagles WR Wilson sidelined for season
content: Eagles wide receiver Johnny Wilson will undergo season-ending knee and ankle surgery, a league source confirmed.

title: Father of Celtics' Brown arrested after stabbing
content: The father of Boston Celtics star Jaylen Brown has been accused of attempted murder in connection to a stabbing Wednesday night in Las Vegas.

title: N'western, ex-football coach Fitzgerald settle suit
content: Northwestern and former football coach Pat Fitzgerald have settled a $130 million lawsuit, which was filed by Fitzgerald after his dismissal two years ago amid allegations of hazing in the program.

title: WNBA breaks single-season attendance record
content: The WNBA's 13 teams have drawn more than 2.5 million fans over 226 games this season, surpassing the previous mark set in 2002.

title: Wrexham signs Man City's Doyle in $10M transfer
content: Wrexham have again spent big to sign England under-21 defender Callum Doyle from Manchester City for a fee of £7.5 million ($10m).

title: 'Prayers answered': Lamar avoids serious injury
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson avoided serious injury after getting his foot stepped on during Wednesday's practice, coach John Harbaugh said.

title: Vince Young's rise to college football legend began at Ohio State
content: Texas' 2005 title run started in Columbus, where Arch Manning and the Longhorns look to build a new legacy in '25.

title: The NFL Enjoyment Index: How fun is your team to watch? We ranked all 32
content: Which NFL teams are must-watches every Sunday this season? We stacked all 32 by excitement, fun and intrigue, starting with Washington.

title: Projecting next year's QB market: Most likely scenarios and long shot possibilities
content: We picked teams with some level of QB1 uncertainty for 2026 and projected two potential outcomes for each.

title: The best picks for each draft slot in Rounds 1 and 2 in 10-team leagues
content: Being prepared for anything gives you a leg up on draft day. We go through every slot to help you plan ahead and get off to a good start in your draft.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Can anyone top this No. 1 team?
content: Baseball's top team is still rolling -- though might be slowing down -- while one NL contender continues its fall down our list in Week 21.

title: Inside Brock Purdy's massive raise -- and the expectations for 2025 that follow
content: Purdy spent the offseason working on little things to improve his game after securing the biggest raise in NFL history.

title: An inside look at Jess Pegula and Jack Draper's first day of US Open mixed doubles
content: Before playing US Open mixed doubles together, Jess Pegula and Jack Draper had hardly spoken. Yet they pulled off two victories on Tuesday.

title: USMNT countdown to the World Cup: Does McKennie have Juve future?
content: Weston McKennie has barely featured for Juventus in preseason. Will he need to leave to ensure he's a starter for the U.S at next summer's World Cup?

title: Real or Not, WNBA playoff race edition: Who’s in, who’s out and which teams will host
content: Which teams might host? Could New York fall to the 4-seed? We examine the teams in the WNBA playoff hunt.

title: How mid-major coaches are embracing -- or resisting -- being high-major launchpads
content: Some mid-major coaches lean into pitching their programs as a development step. Others are reluctant.

title: 32 pick projections, eight months out: Yates’ early NFL mock draft of Round 1 has some surprises
content: Could Arch Manning go No. 1? Will QBs dominate the first round? Which teams could land playmakers? Field Yates projects next year's opening 32 picks.

title: How women's transfer record has skyrocketed with Ovalle's $1.5m move to NWSL
content: Mexico forward Lizbeth Ovalle has moved to the NWSL for $1.5m, so here is the evolution of the transfer record from the past few decades.

title: 10 European storylines to follow: Liverpool and City rebuild, Barca's defense, more
content: Even with predictable title races, each season has its own personality and plotlines. So here are 10 fun plots we're particularly interested in following across Europe as 2025-26 kicks into gear.

title: How Leagues Cup is becoming a hotbed for global scouting
content: With 36 Liga MX and MLS teams playing in Leagues Cup, interest in North American players is on the rise.

title: Predicting how Wirtz, Gyökeres and other big Premier League transfers will perform in 2025-26
content: Loads of big names have arrived in the Premier League this summer, so it's time for Luis Miguel Echegaray to break down who might succeed or flop.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Rogers, Eze after Havertz injury
content: Arsenal are closing on Crystal Palace star Eberechi Eze but are also tracking Aston Villa's Morgan Rogers.

title: Five things to watch in NCAA women's volleyball this season
content: Nebraska, Penn State, Pitt and Louisville are the top four ranked teams as the 2025 volleyball season opens.

title: AFC South betting preview: Texans favored; will Colts, Jags, Titans beat expectations?
content: Is it the Texans' division to lose, or will another team step up? Here are all the odds for each team in the AFC South and our favorite bets.

title: Cloudburst or glacial lake outburst: J&K govt. yet to identify what caused Kishtwar nature’s fury
content: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, who chaired a meeting to review the ongoing relief and rehabilitation measures, underlined that the real cause is still unknown

title: Indian Council of Social Science Research issues show cause notice to CSDS for ‘maligning ECI’, alleges ‘administrative, financial irregularities’
content: ICSSR asks CSDS why its Grant-in-Aid, which reportedly covers 90% of staff salaries and 50% of administrative costs, should not be cancelled; CSDS study on Bihar SIR exercise listed as “major irregularity”

title: Better-informed AI systems are needed for better health messaging
content: If AI systems in the healthcare sector fail to adjust for cultural norms or social dynamics, then there is a risk of replicating existing disparities rather than correcting them

title: SpaceX took oxygen leak before Axiom-4 launch ‘lightly’: ISRO Chairman
content: Insistence on full-fledged test following leak in oxidiser line of the rocket prevented “catastrophic failure” of Axiom-4 mission that carried Shubhanshu Shukla to space, says ISRO Chairman V. Narayanan

title: Former student held after attack on teacher in Madhya Pradesh’s Narsingpur
content: There was an argument between the youth and the woman teacher after he allegedly passed comments on the teacher’s attire on Independence Day this year. The teacher is now stable

title: Defence Minister meets Shubhanshu Shukla, says his journey will motivate young people
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said they discussed Group Captain Shukla’s space mission, his experiments onboard the ISS, technological advances, and the road ahead with India’s upcoming Gaganyaan mission

title: Nitish refuses wear skull cap at madrasa event in Patna
content: A video of the Bihar CM placing the cap on the head of his Cabinet colleague and Minority Welfare Minister Mohammad Zama Khan gained traction on social media

title: Ensure universal registration of births and deaths, RGI tells States
content: Hospitals have to report the event within 21 days, says RGI; in March, RGI said that 10% births were not getting registered in the country

title: Birla, Harivansh flag poor productivity, slam Opposition for disruptions as Monsoon Session ends
content: The Upper House functioned for only 41 hours and 15 minutes, while the Lok Sabha could work only for 37 hours this session.  In their concluding remarks, Mr. Birla and Mr. Harivansh criticised the Opposition members for their behaviour

title: Public notices issued informing non-included Bihar voters to submit Aadhaar along with claims, ECI tells Supreme Court
content: The poll panel says list of names and details of 65 lakh electors not included in draft roll published on August 1 has been posted on websites of all 38 District Electoral Officers in Bihar

title: PM expresses disappointment over Opposition’s absence from debates over crucial Bills
content: Modi says bright and young MPs of Congress did not get to participate in discussions due to the “insecurity” of its leadership

title: Karnataka Transport Department collects over ₹82 lakh fine from errant auto-rickshaw drivers in four months
content: The crackdown, carried out between April and July 2025, came after commuters lodged a spate of complaints about drivers fleecing passengers, refusing rides, and causing harassment

title: Silence will only embolden the bully: Chinese Ambassador on U.S. tariffs
content: Possibly setting the tone for the upcoming SCO Summit in Tianjin, Chinese Ambassador to India Xu Feihong said China stands with India and blamed the U.S., which he called a “bully”, for “using tariffs as a bargaining chip to demand exorbitant prices”

title: Srinagar’s Dal Lake hosts first-ever Khelo India water games with eyes on talent for Olympics
content: At least 409 athletes from 36 States and Union Territories (U.T.s) are participating in the water sports events, competing for 24 gold medals over the next three days

title: Maoists kill villager in Chhattisgarh’s Kanker district
content: Video of the ‘victim’ celebrating Independence Day surfaces on social media; floods delay recovery of body

title: Harassment by microfinance firms: Karnataka mulls ₹5 lakh compensation to kin of victims
content: Chief Minister said cases were on the decline since the Karnataka Micro Loan and Small Loan (Prevention of Coercive Actions) Act came into force in February

title: Supreme Court to pronounce verdict on plea challenging removal of stray dogs from streets of Delhi NCR
content: A Bench led by Justice Vikram Nath will decide on August 22 whether the apex court’s earlier suo motu directive mandating the confinement of strays should be suspended or allowed to operate

title: Tapal Ganesh seeks recovery of ₹884 crore from Obulapuram Mining Company for illegal ore extraction
content: The Ballari miner and activist cites Supreme Court records, CBI judgment and Lokayukta report in support of his claim

title: Should Supreme Court sit powerless as Governors block bills: CJI
content: Solicitor General tells top court to stick to its own turf, saying that delays in State Bills should be handled politically, not through court orders; the court is a custodian of the Constitution, says CJI

title: Palaniswami trains guns on Vijay
content: Just as one could not always debut as a hero in films, a political newcomer could not expect to shine in politics immediately, says AIADMK leader

title: Parliament Monsoon session: Lok Sabha passed 12 bills, Rajya Sabha 14 amid Opposition protests
content: The monsoon session of Parliament, marred by repeated protests and disruptions, saw limited business apart from discussions on Operation Sindoor

title: No surge in seasonal diseases in NTR district: officials
content: After a few fever cases were reported in July, medical camps were held and the situation was brought under control, says District Malaria Officer

title: Assembly Speaker Gaddam Prasad ‘starts’ the process of notices to ‘defected’ MLAs
content: Gaddam Prasad is consulting several legal experts after the Supreme Court set a deadline of three months to decide on the defection notices sent by the BRS

title: CID urges banks to promptly provide documents, CCTV footages to help probe financial fraud cases
content: 136 cases under Prevention of Corruption Act are pending due to lack of proper documents, CID DGP tells bank officials

title: Significant number of cancer drugs don’t fall within price control mechanisms, says report
content: “This regulatory non-inclusion has led to excessive and often unaffordable pricing, thereby limiting access for a large section of the patient population,” the Committee on Petitions said in its report to Parliament

title: Govt. fixes time schedule for inquiry into disciplinary cases against employees
content: Inordinate delays in processing files sometimes allowing employees who are ‘charged’ to escape, says Chief Secretary

title: Ranipet SP flags off round-the-clock Emergency Response Patrol Vehicles to attend to helpline calls
content: Police said the initiative will would strengthen the existing 18 bike and five jeep patrol services that help to prevent highway robberies and other crime within the newly carved district.

title: Protest snowballs against Rahul Mamkootathil
content: Palakkad municipality urges MLA to stay away from municipal bus-stand inauguration taking place on Friday

title: Red letter boxes to stay, being reimagined and digitally monitored, says Chief Post Master General
content: In July 2025 alone, 98.91% of letterboxes were cleared on time, with 11.98 lakh ordinary letters collected

title: PM Modi to flag off Metro Railway services along three stretches in Kolkata
content: The Prime Minister, who will address a public meeting in Kolkata, says public anger against Trinamool Congress is increasing

title: UDF health conclave to be held in Thiruvananthapuram on Friday
content: Recommendations to strengthen Kerala’s preparedness to meet health challenges are expected to emerge from the conclave

title: Kerala’s Peerumade MLA Vazhoor Soman passes away
content: Vazhoor Soman collapses while attending a revenue assembly in Thiruvananthapuram and was rushed to a hospital but his life could not be saved. He was 72

title: Traffic congestion in NH corridor: HC directs forming committee to ready traffic management plan
content: Such a monitoring mechanism was essential to ensure smooth movement of vehicles, especially in view of a 12-hour-long traffic hold-up in the congested Edapally-Thrissur NH 544 corridor

title: HC specifies guidelines for police personnel to arrest persons on court premises
content: Order passed in a suo motu case initiated by the court to deal with clashes reported between police and lawyers on the premises of a court in Alappuzha

title: A.P. Cabinet clears waste recycling policy, slew of infra, welfare initiatives
content: Official Language Commission to be named after Mandali Venkata Krishna Rao, ₹904 crore sanctioned for developing amenities in Amaravati LPS zones

title: FIR filed against journalist Abhisar Sharma by Guwahati police
content: Guwahati Crime Branch files FIR against journalist and YouTuber Abhisar Sharma for video criticising Assam and Union Governments

title: 17th IDSFFK to begin in Thiruvananthapuram on Friday, 331 films from 52 countries to be screened
content: Minister Saji Cherian will formally inaugurate festival at Kairali theatre at 6 p.m. Lifetime Achievement Award for Outstanding Contribution to Documentary Cinema will be presented to Rakesh Sharma, who made acclaimed documentaries including Final Solution, on the Gujarat pogrom of 2002

title: BDA calls global tender to prepare RMP-2041; aims to publish draft in six months
content: At present, the Master Plan in force in the city is RMP-2015, which has been extended for a decade now

title: In sixth visit to Bihar this year, PM to visit Gaya ji, unveil bridge over Ganga in Mokama
content: The PM earlier this year visited Motihari, Bhagalpur, Madhubani, Rohtas, and Siwan districts to address public meetings, lay foundation stones, and unveil several large projects

title: PM Modi to visit Gujarat on August 25 and 26 to inaugurate Awas Yojana houses
content: Nearly 1,449 houses and 130 shops built at a cost of ₹133.42 crore under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban) will be inaugurated by PM Modi in Ahmedabad

title: Mohanlal, Ganesh Kumar take a trip down memory lane
content: Actor takes part in ‘Orma Express’ programme organised as part of a KSRTC expo in Thiruvananthapuram. Chief Minister flags off 143 new KSRTC buses

title: Watch | Vijay: Tamil Nadu’s next big disruptor or a passing storm?
content: In this video, let’s see how Vijay’s Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam is shaking up Tamil Nadu politics — and whether he’s here to disrupt or truly change the game.

title: Border disputes: India, China agree on 10 points; envoy shares roadmap
content: China and India will establish two groups to address border disputes, focusing on delimitation and management, as announced by Chinese ambassador Xu Feihong. Both nations agreed to reopen trade through Lipulekh, Shipki La, and Nathu La passes.

title: Trump says he will join police, troops on patrol in Washington amid tensions
content: President Trump announced plans to join law enforcement and National Guard personnel on patrol in Washington, D.C., amidst increased federal efforts to address crime. This announcement follows a visit by Vice President Vance and other officials to Union Station, where they served burgers to troops, an event disrupted by protesters.

title: AAP assures support for opposition’s VP candidate
content: AAP has three MPs in Lok Sabha and out of its 10 MP posts in Rajya Sabha currently it has nine MPs including the estranged Swati Maliwal. One seat fell vacant after MP Sanjeev Arora won the Ludhiana West assembly bypoll in June.

title: What Dharali & Chasoti disasters have in common
content: The contradiction has led scientists to suggest another possibility -- that these were glacial lake outburst floods, or GLOFs, disasters triggered when melting glaciers or fragile moraine dams gave way. The question matters. If rainfall was not the culprit, then the risks faced by mountain communities are even more unpredictable than assumed.

title: Elon Musk teen prodigy quits after 2 yrs: Tech CEO responds, ‘Never heard of him’
content: Elon Musk claims ignorance of Kairan Quazi's SpaceX departure, despite the 16-year-old prodigy's two-year tenure at the company. Quazi, who joined SpaceX at 14, is transitioning to Citadel Securities, citing a desire for faster-paced challenges in quantitative finance. He previously criticized LinkedIn for age-based restrictions, highlighting biases in opportunity gatekeeping.

title: Shikara boy, 17, rows to first gold of Khelo India for J&K
content: On Thursday, a 17-year-old Kashmiri boy swapped the oars of his shikara for a kayak paddle and whipped up a frenzy generations of his family hadn't known – shouts of "Mohsin! Shabhash, Mohsin!" from the banks of the lake as he neared the finish line of a 1000m kayaking competition to give J&K the first gold of the ongoing Khelo India Water Sports Festival.

title: Maharashtra tragedy: Gas leak at pharma company in Palghar; at least 4 dead
content: A nitrogen gas leak at Medley Pharma in Maharashtra's Palghar district resulted in the tragic deaths of four workers. The incident, which occurred in the Tarapur MIDC industrial area of Boisar, also left two other employees in critical condition, currently receiving intensive care. Authorities have initiated investigations into the circumstances surrounding the fatal leak.

title: Foxconn is no longer Apple's iPhone factory floor, it is now building …
content: Foxconn, known for iPhone production, is changing its business. The company is now focusing on artificial intelligence. It is building AI servers for cloud computing and generative AI. Demand for AI infrastructure is increasing. Foxconn is partnering with Nvidia, Supermicro, and Dell. This move positions Foxconn as a key player in enterprise hardware.

title: 'Silence emboldens bully': China targets Trump's tariffs; 'firmly' stands with India
content: Following Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi's visit, Ambassador Xu Feihong voiced opposition to US tariffs on India, advocating for stronger India-China cooperation as vital for regional growth. Both nations aim to enhance strategic trust, manage differences through dialogue, and seek fair boundary resolutions, including reopening border trade markets and improving trans-border river cooperation.

title: Trump’s $500 million fraud fine axed: President slams NY AG Letitia James, judge
content: A New York appeals court overturned the $500 million civil fraud penalty against Donald Trump, deeming it excessive under the Eighth Amendment. While upholding non-financial sanctions, the court found the penalty unconstitutionally large. Eric Trump hailed the decision as a "total victory," but both sides retain the option to appeal the ruling.

title: Exclusive | ICC Women's World Cup: Cops set tough terms for KSCA to host matches
content: The Karnataka State Cricket Association's hopes of hosting ICC Women's World Cup matches at M Chinnaswamy Stadium are in jeopardy as the police department has issued 17 requirements following the deadly stampede during the IPL victory celebrations on June 4 that left 11 dead. These requirements address concerns about parking, medical facilities, fire safety, women's safety, and security measures.

title: Zuckerberg hits brake: Meta stops hiring and blocks transfers; execs departing
content: Meta has halted AI division hiring amidst a restructuring of its 'Superintelligence Lab,' following a massive recruitment drive that lured talent from competitors with exorbitant compensation packages. This freeze comes after disappointing AI model performance and significant leadership departures, raising investor concerns about Meta's spiraling AI costs and the return on investment.

title: 'Police hiding CCTV footage': AAP's big claim in Delhi CM attack case
content: Saurabh Bhardwaj claims Delhi Police is hiding CCTV footage related to the attack on Rekha Gupta. He contrasts this with the police response to earlier attacks on Arvind Kejriwal. Bhardwaj criticizes the police for not registering those attacks as attempted murder. He supports the BJP's condemnation of violence. Rekha Gupta was attacked during a public hearing.

title: 'Having to just sit out ...': Ashwin opens up on sudden retirement
content: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin revealed the reasons behind his surprising retirement during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy Down Under in December 2024, citing the demanding touring schedule and a desire to spend more time with his family. The veteran off-spinner admitted that being frequently benched on overseas tours contributed to his decision.

title: 'Aligarh's name should be changed': What Keshav Maurya suggested
content: Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya advocated renaming Aligarh to "Harigarh," drawing parallels with the renaming of Ayodhya and Prayagraj. He was speaking at an event commemorating former CM Kalyan Singh, where he also proposed awarding Singh the Bharat Ratna.

title: Ex-Leafs star reacts to shocking rumors on two Matthews teammates
content: Toronto Maple Leafs face an intriguing offseason. Mitch Marner is now with Vegas Golden Knights. The team focuses on Auston Matthews and his supporting cast. John Tavares extends his contract. Matthew Knies will continue his development. Trade rumors involve Nick Robertson and Morgan Rielly. Erik Karlsson is a potential target to strengthen the team's defense.

title: Gronk signs one-day deal to retire as a Patriot
content: Rob Gronkowski announced his plans to sign a one-day contract with the New England Patriots, ensuring his NFL career concludes where it began. With Robert Kraft's approval, this symbolic gesture allows Gronk to retire officially as a Patriot, honoring his legacy and friend Susan Hurley. Patriots fans eagerly anticipate a Foxborough ceremony to celebrate Gronkowski's remarkable career.

title: Vikings owe Harrison Phillips $3.7M after trade to Jets
content: Harrison Phillips, previously with the Minnesota Vikings, has been traded to the New York Jets. The Vikings will cover $3.7 million of Phillips' $7.4 million salary for the 2025 season. In return, the Vikings receive a 2026 and 2027 sixth-round draft pick. Phillips' potential earnings with the Jets include a base salary, roster bonus, and incentives for the upcoming seasons.

title: Jaylen Brown’s father arrested for stabbing man after Las Vegas park dispute
content: Marselles Brown, the father of Celtics star Jaylen Brown, was arrested in Las Vegas for allegedly stabbing a youth football coach following a dispute over a parking spot at All American Park. The victim is in critical but stable condition after undergoing emergency surgery. The incident has sparked widespread reactions, with many questioning the circumstances surrounding the altercation.

title: Alaska summit: Days after Trump-Putin meet, Russia hits US factory in Ukraine
content: A Russian missile hit an American factory in Mukachevo, Ukraine. The attack injured fifteen people. It was part of a large Russian airstrike. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the factory made household items. The strike occurred during US-led peace talks. Oleksandr Merezhko wants Ukraine to join NATO. Russia opposes Western military presence. Both countries have opposing views.

title: 'Where is Shreyas Iyer?': Karthik slams India's Asia Cup squad omission - Watch
content: Dinesh Karthik has voiced his strong disapproval of Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from India's 2025 Asia Cup squad, deeming it somewhat unjust. Iyer's impressive IPL 2025 performance, where he scored 604 runs, seemingly wasn't enough to secure him a spot, even among the reserves. Karthik emphasizes Iyer's leadership and batting prowess under pressure, suggesting his omission is a missed opportunity.

title: 'We will only do what's allowed under law': BCCI secy on online gaming bill
content: With the introduction of the 'Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill 2025', the BCCI faces potential revenue impacts due to key sponsorships from gaming companies like Dream11 and My11Circle. The board has affirmed its commitment to adhering to the new regulations, ready to re-evaluate sponsorships based on the law's stipulations.

title: India-Russia ties: EAM Jaishankar meets President Vladimir Putin
content: During his Russia visit, External Affairs Minister Jaishankar met President Putin to discuss bilateral ties amidst US tariffs on Indian goods and Russian oil purchases. Discussions with Foreign Minister Lavrov focused on strengthening cooperation in various sectors and preparing for the annual summit.

title: 'Bright MPs, insecure leadership': PM Modi's dig at Rahul as Monsoon session ends
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his disappointment over the repeated disruptions in Parliament during the monsoon session, which resulted in low productivity. He indirectly criticized the Congress leadership for allegedly sidelining younger MPs due to insecurity. The session was marked by opposition protests and the passage of key legislation without thorough debate, leading to significant time lost in parliamentary proceedings.

title: In numbers: India's Asia Cup squad – IPL 2025 form under the spotlight
content: India's Asia Cup squad announcement has sparked debate, highlighted by Shubman Gill's vice-captaincy and Jasprit Bumrah's return. Suryakumar Yadav, fresh off a sensational IPL 2025, leads the batting. Selectors favoured recent IPL form, rewarding performers like Abhishek Sharma. Despite strong domestic showings, Shreyas Iyer missed out, emphasising the competition for spots.

title: 'Results of last LS polls manipulated’: Rahul doubles down on 'vote chori' charge
content: Rahul Gandhi has confidently alleged manipulation in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls during a rally in Munger, Bihar. He accused the BJP of 'vote chori' to benefit industrialists, vowing to prevent such actions with the Election Commission. Gandhi asserted this 'vote chori' is an attack on the Constitution.

title: Why hatred against Indians is exploding across the world
content: So when you read about assaults against Indians today — online, offline, in the workplace, on the streets of Dublin, Melbourne, or California — it feels less like an aberration and more like a revert to an old system where politesse had merely deemed that one not be openly racist. Bubbling under the surface, WENA (Western Europe and North America) folks never quite got over their antagonist Lagaan inner Captain Russell maxim: “Tum ghulam log jooti ke neeche rahega.” Except now the “ghulam log” are running tech companies, topping global exams, dictating terms in boardrooms and even becoming prime ministers or vice presidents.

title: Josh Paschal injury update: Dan Campbell says edge rusher may miss 4 games
content: The Detroit Lions' pass rush depth is dwindling as Josh Paschal's return is delayed indefinitely, potentially starting the season on the NFI list. Adding to concerns, rookie Ahmed Hassanein suffered a pectoral injury, further thinning the edge rotation.

title: 'Marking my territory': TVK chief roars at TN rally; no tie-ups with BJP, DMK
content: Vijay, the actor-turned-politician and president of Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK), announced his candidacy for the 2026 Tamil Nadu assembly elections from Madurai East, directly challenging the ruling DMK. He asserted TVK's commitment to Tamil causes, including retrieving Katchatheevu island, and criticized the DMK government's actions against protesting sanitation workers.

title: Gujarat school called water tanker instead of ambulance; boy bled for 30 mins
content: A Class 10 student, Nayan Santani, died after a stabbing at his school in Maninagar. Parents allege the school prioritized cleaning bloodstains over medical assistance. The school allegedly called a water tanker instead of an ambulance. Police and education officials are investigating the school's actions. A preliminary report indicates the school failed to provide immediate medical aid.

title: Trump's claim on India falls flat: US embassy denies USAID for voter turnout
content: The MEA informed the Rajya Sabha that the US Embassy refuted President Trump's claim of USAID allocating $21 million to boost voter turnout in India. The embassy clarified that USAID/India never funded or implemented any voter turnout activities from 2014 to 2024. USAID operations in India have ceased, with funding between 2022 and 2024 directed towards various sectors, excluding elections.

title: Security concerns: Suspected drone sighted over border area of Jammu; probe under way
content: A suspected drone sighting in the Gajansoo border area of Jammu district on Thursday prompted a search operation by security agencies. Residents reported the incident, leading to a response from police and security forces. Authorities are investigating the drone's origin, with concerns heightened due to ongoing drone activity along the International Border, which is guarded by the Border Security Force.

title: 'In future, PM Modi's Hindutva will seem ...': Kishor defends remarks on BJP
content: Prashant Kishor defended his remark about the BJP's shift towards hardline politics, suggesting that future leaders might make even Narendra Modi's tenure seem moderate. He illustrated the BJP's ideological evolution, noting how perceptions of leaders like Vajpayee and Advani have changed over time. Kishor cautioned that this trend could intensify in the coming years.

title: Asia Cup squad | Where does Gill’s elevation as vice-captain leave Hardik?
content: Once considered Rohit Sharma's successor, Hardik Pandya's captaincy aspirations have faded due to injuries and fitness concerns, leading to Suryakumar Yadav's rise as a preferred leader. Despite losing the captaincy role to SKY and Shubman Gill, Pandya's influence within the team remains significant.

title: Suspense ends on IND vs PAK clash in Asia Cup: Sports ministry issues new policy
content: Indian cricket team is set to participate in the upcoming ACC Asia Cup in UAE, as confirmed by the Sports Ministry. This decision comes amidst a continued freeze on bilateral sporting events between India and Pakistan. The ministry clarified that while bilateral contests remain suspended, India will not obstruct multilateral tournaments.

title: Gabrielle Union on Dwyane Wade; family doubted 9-year age gap; ‘took years to earn'
content: Gabrielle Union revealed that Dwyane Wade's family, particularly his sister Tragil, initially doubted their relationship due to their age difference. Union acknowledged it took years to earn their trust, as they questioned her intentions. Over time, they built mutual trust and now share a strong bond, navigating their blended family's complexities together.

title: Only one laddoo? MP man dials CM helpline; files complaint
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district, Kamlesh Kushwaha lodged a complaint on the CM helpline because he received only one laddoo instead of two during Independence Day celebrations. Despite the panchayat purchasing extra laddoos for redistribution, Kushwaha refused to accept them. Officials revealed that Kushwaha has a history of filing numerous complaints.

title: 'Planned disruption': Centre blames oppn for washout - what Monsoon session achieved
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla and Rajya Sabha deputy chairman Harisvansh criticized the opposition for disrupting the Monsoon session, leading to significantly reduced productivity in both houses. Birla lamented the loss of discussion time, while Harivansh highlighted the low percentage of work accomplished.

title: PM Modi To Inaugurate Development Projects Worth Rs 13,000 Crore In Bihar
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be in Bihar on Friday when he is scheduled to inaugurate development projects worth more than Rs 13,000 crore, including a bridge over the river Ganges, besides addressing a rally.

title: Israel Approves Extended Offensive, Hammers Gaza City Overnight
content: Israel hammered Gaza City and its outskirts overnight, residents said Thursday, after the defence ministry approved an expanded offensive to target the remaining Hamas strongholds in the strip.

title: Student Found Dead At Andhra Pradesh College, Suicide Suspected: Police
content: Narasimha Naidu, an IIIT-Ongole student, was found dead at Rajiv Gandhi University of Knowledge Technologies (RGUKT) at Idupulapaya in Andhra Pradesh's YSR Kadapa district on Thursday.

title: "Issues On Iran's Nuclear Programme To Be Solved Through Dialogue And Diplomacy": Minister
content: India has consistently maintained that issues related to Iran's nuclear programme should be resolved through dialogue and diplomacy, while recognising Tehran's "right to peaceful use of nuclear energy", the government told Parliament on Thursday.

title: One In Five Students Rarely Feel Calm Or Motivated: Report
content: Students continue to face high levels of emotional distress, limited access to professional support, and growing uncertainty about their future, even as academic pressure remains the leading source of stress, a report said on Thursday.

title: Russia's Overnight Aerial Strike On Western Ukraine Kills 1, Injures 18
content: Russian overnight attack killed one person, injured at least 18, and struck a US electronics manufacturer in western Ukraine, Ukrainian officials said on Thursday.

title: BIT Mesra Students Stage Protest After 'Blade' Attack On Female Student
content: Students of Birla Institute of Technology (BIT), Mesra, on Thursday staged a demonstration on the campus in protest against an alleged attack on a girl student.

title: Case Registered Against YouTuber Punit Superstar For 'Derogatory Remarks' Against Mayawati
content: Police in Ghaziabad have registered a case against a YouTuber for allegedly making derogatory remarks against Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) president Mayawati on social media, officials said on Thursday.

title: PM Modi On 2-Day Gujarat Visit From August 25, To Inaugurate PMAY Houses
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be on a two-day visit to Gujarat from August 25, during which he will inaugurate 1,449 houses and 130 shops built under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban) here at a cost of Rs 133.42 crore, officials said.

title: Video: 2 Men Hang Off Earthmover To Stop Eviction Drive In Assam
content: In Assam's Hojai district, two men were seen clinging onto an earthmover in a desperate attempt to resist a large-scale eviction drive on government land.

title: Lok Sabha Lost 84 Hours In Monsoon Session Due To Forced Adjournments
content: Parliament's Monsoon session, which concluded on Thursday, saw frequent disruptions that overshadowed legislative business, with the House losing over 84 hours to forced adjournments, the highest in the 18th Lok Sabha.

title: CBI Court Sentences 3 Postal Officials In Rs 1.21-Crore Forgery Case
content: A Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court in Jabalpur has convicted and sentenced three officials of the Postal Department in Madhya Pradesh for their role in a corruption case that caused over Rs 1.21 crore loss to the government exchequer.

title: Gang Posing As CBI Officials Rob Rs 2.3 Crore In Delhi, 2 Arrested: Cops
content: A gang of robbers, including a woman, allegedly posing as Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) officials, looted around Rs 2.3 crore from a businessman's office in Vivek Vihar, the police said on Thursday.

title: After Poll Body Order, Bengal Suspends 4 Officials, But Doesn't File Cases
content: The West Bengal government has partly complied with the Election Commission of India's directive by suspending four officials of the Moyna and Baruipur Purba Assembly Constituencies for alleged voter list malpractices

title: Others Got 2 Laddus, He Got 1. Then He Dialled Chief Minister's Helpline
content: A villager in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district dialled the Chief Minister's Helpline with an unusual grievance - he received only one laddu instead of two.

title: "India Doesn't Take Any Position On Matters Of Faith, Religion": Minister On Dalai Lama's Succession
content: The MEA said it has seen a statement issued by the 14th Dalai Lama in July about the institution of the Dalai Lama, and underlined that it "does not take any position" on matters concerning beliefs and practices of faith and religion.

title: Parliament Session Over, Amit Shah Crafts BJP's Poll Push in South
content: The monsoon session of Parliament wrapped up, Union Home Minister Amit Shah has shifted focus to the southern battlegrounds of Kerala and Tamil Nadu, signalling the BJP's intent to expand its footprint in southern states.

title: China And Pakistan Agree To Launch New Economic Corridor Projects
content: Pakistan and China pledged to expand economic cooperation and investment under the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor, a flagship program of China's Belt and Road Initiative, officials said.

title: Case Against Journalist Abhisar Sharma For 'Ridiculing' Assam, Centre
content: The Guwahati Crime Branch on Thursday registered a First Information Report (FIR) against journalist and YouTuber Abhisar Sharma on the basis of a complaint filed by a local resident alleging that he had uploaded a video ridiculing both the Assam and

title: Tariffs Aren't Keeping Walmart From Attracting Shoppers And Outpacing Target
content: Walmart Inc. powered through an uncertain economic environment and tariff concerns to deliver solid second-quarter financial results Thursday, showing it keeps pulling in shoppers and outpacing peers like Target.

title: The Unforgotten: Two QBs and the game that tied them together forever

title: Jake Paul vs. Gervonta Davis: All you need to know about the Nov. 14 fight
content: a fight between a 135-pound world champion and a YouTuber-turned-prizefighter has come out of nowhere . the announcement comes as a potential heavyweight showdown with former unified champion Anthony Joshua . a rematch with lamont Roach Jr. has been linked to the fight .

title: Bueckers puts on a show with 'dream celebrity' Shemar Moore on hand
content: the "Criminal Minds" actor sets the WNBA rookie scoring record . she tallied 44 points, 4 rebounds, 3 assists and 1 steal in 81-80 loss to the los Angeles Sparks . "you never know when your boy might show and HOLLA your name at one of your games"

title: UFC Fight Night: Expert picks, best bets for Johnny Walker vs. Zhang Mingyang
content: Zhang Mingyang has three first-round knockouts in his first three UFC bouts . his opponent, Johnny Walker , is the only other person in history to have won his first 3 fights by KO . the co-main event features two top-10 featherweights in ESPN's divisional rankings .

title: What do NFL scouts think of Arch Manning and what can Texas expect from him?
content: arch Manning will get his chance to be the face of the longhorns this season . he won't get the chance to ease into the starting role as top-ranked Texas will play at defending national champion and no. 3-ranked Ohio State in its season opener on august 30 .

title: Inside 'Camp Glenn': Tackling the owner, a vintage whistle and a full-circle moment
content: first-year coach was the defensive coordinator of the Detroit Lions . he lost 45 of his first 64 games before reaching the AFC Championship game in 1998 . the new york Jets are preparing for the playoffs on tuesday .

title: Updated top 100 MLB prospect rankings: There's a new No. 1
content: a lot has changed since the last time we ranked the top MLB prospects . some of the prospects in our ranking are in different places after a busy trade deadline . this is my ranking of these players for the long term, considering their upside, risk and proximity to the big leagues .

title: What to know about the 2025 PFL middleweight, light heavyweight and heavyweight finals
content: the PFL ends its 2025 season in a big way on Thursday in Hollywood, Florida . heavyweight and light heavyweight are among the final three weight classes to crown tournament champions . the main event pits 2024 PFL heavyweight finalist Oleg Popov against Alexander Romanov .

title: 'I'm living proof': How Lucas Erceg is using his sobriety journey to inspire others
content: the softball field at Boonville Correctional Center has two fences . the first is a standard outfield fence stretching from foul line to foul line . it's a stark reminder that the field is, quite literally, a diamond in the rough .

title: ↔️ 2026 college football recruiting class rankings
content: the recruiting wheel keeps spinning and has resulted in some movers . the race for positioning in the rankings, including at the very top, never seems settled until signing day in December makes it all official . ESPN 300 commits: 19 Top offensive prospect: OT Keenyi Pepe Top defensive prospect: CB Elbert Hill No program has more 2026 momentum than USC under Lincoln Riley .

title: College Football 2025: Ranking the best players from 1 to 100
content: a list of the top 10 college football players entering the season is no easy task . it requires a mix of information, reporting and assumptions . some choices are easy and some projections are nearly universally agreed upon . at least a few will be hisman Trophy contenders by season's end .

title: Did Broncos win Devaughn Vele trade? Grading offseason trades
content: the bulk of the offseason might be over, but NFL teams still can mold their rosters between now and week 1 . there are still weaknesses to shore up, players whom teams want to move on from and looming contracts to be settled . the Dolphins traded cornerback Jalen Ramsey and tight end Jonnu Smith to the Steelers for safety Minkah Fitzpatrick .

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: CFB Player Rank: Who should've made the top 10? What were the biggest surprises?
content: the big Ten is floating the idea of expanding the College Football Playoff to 24 or 28 teams . the college football reporters break down the entire ranking, including what players our committee missed entirely . our selection committee included Bill Connelly, David Hale, Chris Low, Adam Rittenberg and Paolo Uggetti.
